_description: Reflexion entries are self-assessments by the agent after a correction. They get injected into the system prompt on future executions of the same skill, enabling the agent to learn from mistakes.

entries.mistake: Applied uniform moderate risk profile across all markets/currencies when user had a time-sensitive goal requiring aggressive India equity allocation.
entries.root_cause: Treated risk_profile as a single global value. Did not consider per-market or per-goal risk differentiation.
entries.rule: When a user has goals with different timelines and currency requirements, assess risk per-goal and per-market, not just overall. A moderate investor can be aggressive in one market and conservative in another.
entries.applies_when: User has multiple goals across different currencies OR explicitly mentions wanting different risk levels for different holdings.

entries.mistake: Classified an alert as Quick Approve based on low amount and repeat beneficiary, without checking if the beneficiary was receiving from multiple users.
entries.root_cause: Evaluated alert in isolation. Did not perform cross-user beneficiary analysis before classification.
entries.rule: ALWAYS check beneficiary_id across all users in the batch and recent history before any Quick Approve classification. A beneficiary receiving from 3+ unique users in 7 days MUST go to Needs Investigation regardless of individual transaction characteristics.
entries.applies_when: Any triage classification, especially Quick Approve.
